Q Line - Weekend Planned Service Change

Transfer between Q trains and buses at Kings Hwy, and/or between buses and D, N, R trains at Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr. Transfer between D, N, R and M trains at 34 St-Herald Sq. New Schedule on Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines, Effective Nov. 3, 2019 - Dec. 8 2019

NJ Transit has advised Metro-North of a schedule adjustment effective Sunday, Nov. 3, 2019, which will result in minor changes to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction and minor changes in the departure and arrival times of select trains. The changes will be in effect until Dec. 8, 2019 when a new schedule goes into effect. The changes on the Port Jervis Line are the result of cab signal installation in support of Positive Train Control implementation. On the Pascack Valley Line: Two southbound trains have adjustments to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction, resulting in arrivals at Penn Sta.- New York 4 to 5 minutes earlier. On the Port Jervis Line Eastbound / Inbound Eight eastbound trains in the morning will have earlier departure times between of between 1 and 4 minutes; Two eastbound trains in the morning and mid-day have adjustments to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction, resulting in arrivals at Penn Sta. - New York between 4 and 11 minutes earlier. Westbound/ Outbound Six westbound trains in the afternoon /evening arrive at their destination between 1 and 4 minutes later than the regularly scheduled time. See full schedule details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/NewSch4PortJervis11032019.htm Pick up a schedule at a ticket office, consult http://new.mta.info, or go online to Metro-North's website, at http://www.mta.info/mnr.

Flushing-Main Street Customers: Meet Your Manager Tomorrow

Tomorrow, November 4, the LIRR will continue its Meet Your Manager series with an event at - Flushing-Main Street, from 6:30AM-8:00AM Customers can speak with their Branch Line Manager to ask questions, give feedback, or simply say hello. Thank you, and we hope to see you soon!
Meet Your Manager Events, This Week

The LIRR will continue its Meet Your Manager series this week during the morning rush hour on the following dates and locations: - Flushing-Main Street (11/4, 6:30AM-8:00AM) - Atlantic Terminal (11/7, 4:00PM-6:00PM) - Patchogue (11/7, 5:30AM-7:30AM) - Wantagh (11/7, 6:30AM-8:00AM) - Locust Valley (11/8, 5:45AM-7:45AM) - Floral Park (11/8, 6:30AM-8:00AM) Our Branch Line & Terminal Managers are at their respective stations regularly, coordinating everything from station cleaning to announcements, to ensure your experience with us is as seamless and pleasant as possible. Customers can meet their Branch Line Managers, ask questions or give feedback. While customers are invited to engage with them any time, these events are specially designed to introduce our managers to the customers they serve. Stay tuned for further announcements with dates and times for your home station, as we continue to roll out this program systemwide. Thank you, and we hope to see you soon!

New Schedule on Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines, Effective Nov. 3, 2019 - Dec. 8 2019

NJ Transit has advised Metro-North of a schedule adjustment effective Sunday, Nov. 3, 2019, which will result in minor changes to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction and minor changes in the departure and arrival times of select trains. The changes will be in effect until Dec. 8, 2019 when a new schedule goes into effect. The changes on the Port Jervis Line are the result of cab signal installation in support of Positive Train Control implementation. On the Pascack Valley Line: Two southbound trains have adjustments to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction, resulting in arrivals at Penn Sta.- New York 4 to 5 minutes earlier. On the Port Jervis Line Eastbound / Inbound Eight eastbound trains in the morning will have earlier departure times between of between 1 and 4 minutes; Two eastbound trains in the morning and mid-day have adjustments to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction, resulting in arrivals at Penn Sta. - New York between 4 and 11 minutes earlier. Westbound/ Outbound Six westbound trains in the afternoon /evening arrive at their destination between 1 and 4 minutes later than the regularly scheduled time. See full schedule details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/NewSch4PortJervis11032019.htm Pick up a schedule at a ticket office, consult http://new.mta.info, or go online to Metro-North's website, at http://www.mta.info/mnr.

New Schedule on Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines, Effective Nov. 3, 2019 - Dec. 8 2019

NJ Transit has advised Metro-North of a schedule adjustment effective Sunday, Nov. 3, 2019, which will result in minor changes to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction and minor changes in the departure and arrival times of select trains. The changes will be in effect until Dec. 8, 2019 when a new schedule goes into effect. The changes on the Port Jervis Line are the result of cab signal installation in support of Positive Train Control implementation. On the Pascack Valley Line: Two southbound trains have adjustments to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction, resulting in arrivals at Penn Sta.- New York 4 to 5 minutes earlier. On the Port Jervis Line Eastbound / Inbound Eight eastbound trains in the morning will have earlier departure times between of between 1 and 4 minutes; Two eastbound trains in the morning and mid-day have adjustments to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction, resulting in arrivals at Penn Sta. - New York between 4 and 11 minutes earlier. Westbound/ Outbound Six westbound trains in the afternoon /evening arrive at their destination between 1 and 4 minutes later than the regularly scheduled time. See full schedule details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/NewSch4PortJervis11032019.htm Pick up a schedule at a ticket office, consult http://new.mta.info, or go online to Metro-North's website, at http://www.mta.info/mnr.

New Schedule on Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines, Effective Nov. 3, 2019 - Dec. 8 2019

NJ Transit has advised Metro-North of a schedule adjustment effective Sunday, Nov. 3, 2019, which will result in minor changes to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction and minor changes in the departure and arrival times of select trains. The changes will be in effect until Dec. 8, 2019 when a new schedule goes into effect. The changes on the Port Jervis Line are the result of cab signal installation in support of Positive Train Control implementation. On the Pascack Valley Line: Two southbound trains have adjustments to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction, resulting in arrivals at Penn Sta.- New York 4 to 5 minutes earlier. On the Port Jervis Line Eastbound / Inbound Eight eastbound trains in the morning will have earlier departure times between of between 1 and 4 minutes; Two eastbound trains in the morning and mid-day have adjustments to connecting trains at Secaucus Junction, resulting in arrivals at Penn Sta. - New York between 4 and 11 minutes earlier. Westbound/ Outbound Six westbound trains in the afternoon /evening arrive at their destination between 1 and 4 minutes later than the regularly scheduled time. See full schedule details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/NewSch4PortJervis11032019.htm Pick up a schedule at a ticket office, consult http://new.mta.info, or go online to Metro-North's website, at http://www.mta.info/mnr.

NYC, SIM1C, SIM3 and SIM33C Buses, TCS NYC Marathon

Sunday November 3, 1 AM to 7 PM, SIM1C, SIM3C and SIM33C buses are detoured because of the TCS NYC Marathon. Detour is as follows: Towards Midtown: Last stop towards Manhattan will be on Narrows Road South at Steuben St. Left on Narrows Road North, enter Staten Island Expressway West to the Bayonne Bridge into the New Jersey Turnpike left into the Holland Tunnel using West St exit, into Laight St, left on West St, left on Battery Place and regular route to 57 St, left on 57 St, left on 7 Av to Last stop on 7 Av at 57 St. SIM1C towards Eltingville: First stop towards Staten Island on 7 Av at 57 St, via 7 Av, left on 50 St, right on 5 Av, stay on regular route towards West St, into Holland Tunnel, using New Jersey Turnpike to the Goethals Bridge onto the Staten Island Expressway using Richmond Av exit to Eltingville Transit Center, left on Wainwright Av, right on Richmond Av, left on Hylan Blvd to Narrows Road South as the last stop. SIM3C and SIM33C towards Port Richmond/Mariners Harbor: First stop towards Staten Island on 7 Av at 57 St, via 7 Av, left on 50 St, right on 5 Av, stay on regular route towards West St, into Holland Tunnel, using New Jersey Turnpike to the Goethals Bridge onto the Staten Island Expressway, exit on Clove Road into Narrows Road South, left on Fingerboard Road, left on Narrows Road North and regular route.

Eastbound Trains Bypass Woodside, Kew Gardens & Forest Hills

Eastbound trains are temporarily bypassing Woodside, Forest Hills & Kew Gardens due to preparatory work for this weekend's East Side Access signal work. NYC Transit will cross-honor LIRR fares on the 7 train at Woodside (61St Street), and the E train at Forest Hills (71st Avenue) and Kew Gardens (Union Tpke). Customers at Penn Station can take Pt. Washington Branch trains to Woodside. Customers at Woodside can take the 7 line (61st Street) to Roosevelt Av-Jackson Heights, transfer to the E line and exit at Jamaica Station (Sutphin Blvd-Archer) where eastbound LIRR service is available. Customers at Forest Hills and Kew Gardens can take the E to Jamaica and transfer to eastbound LIRR service.

LIRR crews are en route to multiple grade crossings along the Long Beach Branch where crossing gates remain in the down position due to a signal problem. As a precaution, we have directed trains to operate at reduced speeds through the area and customers can expect 5-10 minute delays. Safety First! Never drive around LIRR crossing gates when they are down and the lights are flashing; a train could be approaching from either direction at any time. We will update you on repair progress shortly.

An Explanation for This Morning's Delays on the New Haven Line

On the New Haven Line around 12:30 AM this morning, a fallen tree damaged the catenary in the area between Milford and New Haven. As a result, power was disrupted and service halted between New Haven and Westport, and on the Waterbury Branch. A downed tree on the New Canaan Branch also knocked out service on the branch. Crews worked through the night to make repairs, and by 7:45 AM, service was restored to two tracks on the New Haven Line between Westport and New Haven and service was restored to the New Canaan Line around 9 AM. On the Waterbury Line morning busing was being provided, and train service was restored at 1 PM.

Meet Your Manager Events, Week of November 4

The LIRR will continue its Meet Your Manager series next week during the morning rush hour on the following dates and locations: - Flushing-Main Street (11/4, 6:30AM-8:00AM) - Atlantic Terminal (11/7, 4:00PM-6:00PM) - Patchogue (11/7, 5:30AM-7:30AM) - Wantagh (11/7, 6:30AM-8:00AM) - Locust Valley (11/8, 5:45AM-7:45AM) - Floral Park (11/8, 6:30AM-8:00AM) Our Branch Line & Terminal Managers are at their respective stations regularly, coordinating everything from station cleaning to announcements, to ensure your experience with us is as seamless and pleasant as possible. Customers can meet their Branch Line Managers, ask questions or give feedback. While customers are invited to engage with them any time, these events are specially designed to introduce our managers to the customers they serve. Stay tuned for further announcements with dates and times for your home station, as we continue to roll out this program systemwide. Thank you, and we hope to see you soon!
